text: The 2018 Porsche Mobil 1 Supercup was the 26th Porsche Supercup season. It began on 13 May at Circuit de Catalunya and ended on 28 October at Autódromo Hermanos Rodríguez, after ten scheduled races, all of which were support events for the 2018 Formula One season. ==Teams and drivers== {|align="right" class="wikitable" style="font-size: 85%;" |- |} The paddock at the Red Bull Ring in 2018 Safety car at the Red Bull Ring in 2018 Shortly before the restart at the Red Bull Ring in 2018 Thomas Preining after his first victory at the Red Bull Ring in 2018 Entry list was announced on 3 May 2018: {|class="wikitable" style="font-size: 85%;" !Team ! !Drivers !Rounds |- |rowspan=3| BWT Lechner Racing | 1 | Michael Ammermüller | All |- | 2 | Thomas Preining | All |- | 40 | Dino Zamparelli | 4 |- |rowspan=4| Momo Megatron Lechner Racing Team | 3 | Dylan Pereira | All |- | 4 | Josh Webster | All |- | rowspan=2 | 30 | Philip Hamprecht | 1-7 |- | Jean-Baptiste Simmenauer | 8-10 |- |rowspan=4| Fach Auto Tech | 57 | Jaap van Lagen | All |- | 6 | Nick Yelloly | All |- | rowspan=2| 7 | Christof Langer | 1–7 |- | Roman de Angelis | 9-10 |- |rowspan=7| Lechner Racing Middle East | 8 | Al Faisal Al Zubair | All |- | 9 | Roar Lindland | All |- |rowspan=4| 29 | Philip Hamprecht | 1 |- | Magnus Öhman | 2 |- | Khalid Al Wahaibi | 3-7 |- | Igor Walilko | 8-10 |- | 30 | Charlie Frijns | 7 |- |rowspan=5| Dinamic Motorsport | 10 | Mattia Drudi | All |- |rowspan=3| 11 | Ronnie Valori | 1 |- | Gianmarco Quaresmini | 2-8 |- | Alessio Rovera | 9-10 |- | 12 | Alberto Cerqui | All |- |rowspan=6| MRS GT- Racing | 14 | Mikkel O.
